\cocoatextscaling0\cocoaplatform0{\fonttbl\f0\fswiss\fcharset0 Helvetica;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} {\*\expandedcolortbl;;} \margl1440\margr1440\vieww11520\viewh8400\viewkind0 \pard\tx720\tx1440\tx2160\tx2880\tx3600\tx4320\tx5040\tx5760\tx6480\tx7200\tx7920\tx8640\pardirnatural\partightenfactor0 \f0\fs24 \cf0 <%@ Language="VBScript" %>\ \ \ <%\ Option Explicit\ \ Call EnsureInMemoryData()\ Call RequireLogin()\ \ Dim action\ action = LCase(Trim(Request("action")))\ \ Select Case action\ Case "create"\ Call HandleCreate()\ Case "update"\ Call HandleUpdate()\ End Select\ \ Sub HandleCreate()\ Dim custId, status, total\ custId = CLng(0)\ status = Trim(Request.Form("status"))\ total = CDbl(0)\ \ On Error Resume Next\ custId = CLng(Request.Form("customerId"))\ total = CDbl(Request.Form("total"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ If custId <= 0 Or status = "" Or total <= 0 Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "All fields are required, total must be > 0."\ End If\ \ Dim orders, nextId\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ Application.Lock\ nextId = CLng(Application("NextOrderId"))\ orders.Add nextId, Array(custId, status, total, Now())\ Application("NextOrderId") = nextId + 1\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & nextId & " created."\ End Sub\ \ Sub HandleUpdate()\ Dim orderId, newStatus\ orderId = CLng(0)\ On Error Resume Next\ orderId = CLng(Request.Form("orderId"))\ On Error GoTo 0\ \ newStatus = Trim(Request.Form("newStatus"))\ If orderId <= 0 Or newStatus = "" Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order ID and new status are required."\ End If\ \ Dim orders\ Set orders = Application("Orders")\ \ If Not orders.Exists(orderId) Then\ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order not found."\ End If\ \ Dim data\ data = orders(orderId)\ \ Dim custId, total, createdAt\ custId = data(0)\ total = data(2)\ createdAt = data(3)\ \ Application.Lock\ orders(orderId) = Array(custId, newStatus, total, createdAt)\ Application.UnLock\ \ RedirectWithFlash "orders.asp", "Order " & orderId & " updated."\ End Sub\ \ Call RenderHeader("Orders")\ %>\ \

IDCustomerStatusTotalCreatedUpdate status
<%=oid%><%=HtmlEncode(custName)%><%=HtmlEncode(status)%><%=FormatCurrency(total, 2)%><%=createdAt%>\

system_context_model.summary: Legacy ASP application for managing customer orders, to be modernized to TypeScript.

convention_profile.summary: Legacy ASP application conventions with focus on modernization to TypeScript.

rules.rule: Use camelCase for variable and function names.
Session variables should be used for authentication state.

lint_recommendations: Refactor VBScript to TypeScript using consistent naming conventions.
Ensure all authentication logic is migrated to a secure TypeScript framework.
scaffold_templates: TypeScript Express.js template for customer and order management.

health_assessment.summary: Assessment of legacy ASP application for modernization.

hotspots.reason: Session management is handled in VBScript, which is less secure.

risks.title: Security Risk
risks.description: Legacy ASP application uses session management that may be vulnerable to attacks.

remediation_backlog.title: Migrate VBScript to TypeScript
remediation_backlog.problem_statement: Legacy ASP application is written in VBScript, which is outdated and less secure.
remediation_backlog.risk_if_unaddressed: Continued use of outdated and insecure technology stack.
remediation_backlog.suggested_approach: Refactor the entire application to TypeScript using modern frameworks like Express.js.
success_criteria: All modules are rewritten in TypeScript.
Application runs successfully in a local Docker environment.

agent_results.summary: Extracted 8 functional requirements, 5 non-functional requirements, 5 risks, 3 clarifications, 0 failed quality gates [software-general-v1]

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase to TypeScript, ensuring backward compatibility and documenting functionality.
requirements_understanding: The legacy codebase must be translated into TypeScript while maintaining existing functionality.
Backward compatibility is crucial, meaning the new TypeScript code should behave identically to the legacy ASP code.
The modernization process includes documenting current functionality, designing architecture, implementing rewritten services, and running QA/security checks.
Deployment for local Docker testing is required to validate the modernization.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Use TypeScript for the new implementation to ensure type safety and modern language features.
Implement services using a modular architecture to facilitate maintainability and scalability.
Utilize Docker for consistent local testing environments.
Ensure that all session and application state management in ASP is accurately replicated in TypeScript.
clarifications_requested: Are there any specific performance improvements expected beyond maintaining current functionality?
Should the modernization include any new features or strictly adhere to legacy functionality?
What are the specific security requirements or standards that need to be adhered to during modernization?

output.executive_summary: The project aims to modernize a legacy ASP codebase to TypeScript, ensuring backward compatibility and documenting functionality for deployment in a Docker environment.

functional_requirements.title: Initialize Application State
functional_requirements.description: The application should initialize with a name and track total sessions, similar to the legacy ASP Application_OnStart.
acceptance_criteria: Application name is set to 'Legacy Customer Orders'.
Total sessions start at 0 and increment correctly.
State is maintained across sessions.

functional_requirements.title: User Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Manage user sessions to track authentication status and user-specific messages, replicating Session_OnStart and Session_OnEnd behavior.
acceptance_criteria: User sessions initialize with 'IsAuthenticated' set to false.
Sessions increment and decrement total session count correctly.
Flash messages are set and cleared appropriately.

functional_requirements.title: User Authentication
functional_requirements.description: Authenticate users based on provided username, replicating the login process in 'customer.asp'.
acceptance_criteria: Users must provide a username to authenticate.
Successful login sets 'IsAuthenticated' to true and stores the username.
Failed login attempts provide appropriate feedback messages.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Data Display
functional_requirements.description: Display customer data in a tabular format, ensuring data is sourced from in-memory storage.
acceptance_criteria: Customer data is retrieved from in-memory storage.
Data is displayed in a table with correct formatting.
Only authenticated users can view customer data.

functional_requirements.title: Order Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement order creation and update functionalities, ensuring data consistency and validation.
acceptance_criteria: Orders can be created with valid customer ID, status, and total.
Orders can be updated with a new status.
Invalid inputs are handled with appropriate error messages.

functional_requirements.title: Session-Based Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging to provide feedback to users, similar to the legacy RedirectWithFlash function.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are set during redirects.
Messages are displayed once and cleared after being shown.
Flash messages appear in a consistent format across the application.

functional_requirements.title: HTML Rendering
functional_requirements.description: Render HTML headers and footers consistently, replicating the RenderHeader and RenderFooter functions.
acceptance_criteria: HTML headers include application name and navigation links.
Footers display application information and current time.
HTML is rendered with consistent styling.

functional_requirements.title: Data Encoding and Security
functional_requirements.description: Ensure data is securely encoded for HTML output, replicating HtmlEncode functionality.
acceptance_criteria: All user input is encoded before being rendered in HTML.
No HTML injection vulnerabilities are present.
Encoding is consistent with legacy behavior.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should perform at least as efficiently as the legacy system.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Response time under 200ms for typical operations
acceptance_criteria: Response times are measured and documented.
Performance is consistent under typical load conditions.
No significant performance degradation from legacy system.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is secure against common web vulnerabilities.
acceptance_criteria: Application passes security audits.
No critical vulnerabilities are present.
Security measures are documented and tested.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be scalable to handle increased load.
acceptance_criteria: Scalability tests are conducted and documented.
Application supports increased load without performance loss.
Architecture supports horizontal scaling.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is reliable and available.
acceptance_criteria: Downtime is minimized and documented.
Application recovers gracefully from failures.
Monitoring and alerting are in place.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be user-friendly and easy to navigate.
acceptance_criteria: User feedback is collected and analyzed.
Navigation is intuitive and consistent.
Documentation and help resources are available.

agent_results.summary: Modular-Monolith architecture with 4 services on None

output.overview: The architecture modernizes a legacy ASP application to a TypeScript-based modular monolith, ensuring backward compatibility and improved maintainability. The system is designed for local deployment using Docker, facilitating consistent testing and development environments.

services.name: ApplicationStateService
services.responsibility: Manage application-wide state such as total sessions and application name.

services.name: SessionManagementService
services.responsibility: Handle user session lifecycle, including authentication and flash messaging.

services.name: CustomerDataService
services.responsibility: Provide customer data management and display functionality.

services.name: OrderManagementService
services.responsibility: Manage order creation, updating, and retrieval.

auto_scaling_rules: Scale out when CPU usage exceeds 70%
Scale in when CPU usage falls below 30%
scalability.caching_strategy: Use Redis for session and frequently accessed data caching

data_flow.description: User initiates a session and authenticates.
Update application state with new session count.
Authenticated user creates or updates an order.

latency_optimizations: Use in-memory data storage for fast access
Implement Redis caching for session data

trade_offs.rationale: Simplifies the architecture and improves latency for local testing.
Ensures consistent environments for development and testing.
Provides fast access to session and frequently accessed data.

legacy_system.current_logic_summary: The legacy system uses ASP with VBScript to manage application state, user sessions, customer data, and orders.
key_logic_steps: Manage user sessions with authentication and flash messaging.
Authenticate users and manage session state.
Display customer data from in-memory storage.
Create and update orders with validation.

non_functional.description: All critical state changes are traceable to actor, action, and outcome.
acceptance_criteria: Audit event schema is defined.
Critical actions emit audit events.
Evidence links are available for release verification.

non_functional.title: Security controls
non_functional.description: Sensitive data handling follows masking and least-privilege principles.
non_functional.metric: No unmasked sensitive identifiers in logs
acceptance_criteria: Sensitive fields are redacted in logs.
Authorization controls are explicitly defined.
Security test coverage includes critical paths.

open_questions.question: Are there existing operational constraints or integration dependencies not listed?

quality_gates.name: requirements_completeness
quality_gates.message: At least one functional requirement exists.

vector_context_used.title: Idempotent financial writes
vector_context_used.snippet: Financial write endpoints should require an idempotency key, persist request hash, and return the original response for retried keys with the same payload.

vector_context_used.title: PII-safe logging
vector_context_used.snippet: Logs must avoid raw personal identifiers. Use central redaction, field allowlists, and explicit data retention windows per tenant policy.

vector_context_used.title: Audit evidence chain
vector_context_used.snippet: Every regulated requirement should map to tests and release evidence. Audit events should include actor, action, timestamp, correlation_id, and outcome.

team.name: Synthetix Modernization Team
team.description: Legacy modernization team focused on functional parity and migration safety.

1.persona: Prioritize legacy parity, interface contracts, backward compatibility, and modernization risk documentation.

2.persona: Map legacy flows to modern services while minimizing migration risk and preserving business behavior.

3.persona: Rewrite legacy logic with functional parity first, then improve modularity without changing behavior.

4.persona: Design low-risk schema/data migration scripts with rollback plans and validation checkpoints.

5.persona: Produce threat models, prioritized security controls, and release-gating recommendations.

6.persona: Run actionable checks, separate environment issues from code defects, and produce clear remediation guidance.

7.persona: Validate requirement coverage clearly for business stakeholders with traceable evidence.

8.persona: Prefer local Docker deployability, deterministic health checks, and clear run instructions.

rules.title: Use camelCase for variable and function names.
rules.statement: Use camelCase for variable and function names.

rules.title: Session variables should be used for authentication state.
rules.statement: Session variables should be used for authentication state.

templates.name: TypeScript Express.js template for customer and order management.

key_themes: Assessment of legacy ASP application for modernization.
summary.recommendation: Prioritize P0/P1 remediation items and enforce convention gates in CI
summary.notes: Generated from SIL health assessment and remediation backlog

findings.title: Hotspot: Security
findings.description: Session management is handled in VBScript, which is less secure.

findings.title: Security Risk
findings.description: Legacy ASP application uses session management that may be vulnerable to attacks.

backlog.title: Migrate VBScript to TypeScript
backlog.business_value: Continued use of outdated and insecure technology stack.
plan: Refactor the entire application to TypeScript using modern frameworks like Express
acceptance_criteria: All modules are rewritten in TypeScript.
Application runs successfully in a local Docker environment.

analysis_walkthrough.business_objective_summary: Modernize a legacy ASP codebase to TypeScript, ensuring backward compatibility and documenting functionality.
requirements_understanding: The legacy codebase must be translated into TypeScript while maintaining existing functionality.
Backward compatibility is crucial, meaning the new TypeScript code should behave identically to the legacy ASP code.
The modernization process includes documenting current functionality, designing architecture, implementing rewritten services, and running QA/security checks.
Deployment for local Docker testing is required to validate the modernization.
conversion_to_technical_requirements: Use TypeScript for the new implementation to ensure type safety and modern language features.
Implement services using a modular architecture to facilitate maintainability and scalability.
Utilize Docker for consistent local testing environments.
Ensure that all session and application state management in ASP is accurately replicated in TypeScript.
clarifications_requested: Are there any specific performance improvements expected beyond maintaining current functionality?
Should the modernization include any new features or strictly adhere to legacy functionality?
What are the specific security requirements or standards that need to be adhered to during modernization?

analyst_output.executive_summary: The project aims to modernize a legacy ASP codebase to TypeScript, ensuring backward compatibility and documenting functionality for deployment in a Docker environment.

functional_requirements.title: Initialize Application State
functional_requirements.description: The application should initialize with a name and track total sessions, similar to the legacy ASP Application_OnStart.
acceptance_criteria: Application name is set to 'Legacy Customer Orders'.
Total sessions start at 0 and increment correctly.
State is maintained across sessions.

functional_requirements.title: User Session Management
functional_requirements.description: Manage user sessions to track authentication status and user-specific messages, replicating Session_OnStart and Session_OnEnd behavior.
acceptance_criteria: User sessions initialize with 'IsAuthenticated' set to false.
Sessions increment and decrement total session count correctly.
Flash messages are set and cleared appropriately.

functional_requirements.title: User Authentication
functional_requirements.description: Authenticate users based on provided username, replicating the login process in 'customer.asp'.
acceptance_criteria: Users must provide a username to authenticate.
Successful login sets 'IsAuthenticated' to true and stores the username.
Failed login attempts provide appropriate feedback messages.

functional_requirements.title: Customer Data Display
functional_requirements.description: Display customer data in a tabular format, ensuring data is sourced from in-memory storage.
acceptance_criteria: Customer data is retrieved from in-memory storage.
Data is displayed in a table with correct formatting.
Only authenticated users can view customer data.

functional_requirements.title: Order Management
functional_requirements.description: Implement order creation and update functionalities, ensuring data consistency and validation.
acceptance_criteria: Orders can be created with valid customer ID, status, and total.
Orders can be updated with a new status.
Invalid inputs are handled with appropriate error messages.

functional_requirements.title: Session-Based Flash Messaging
functional_requirements.description: Implement flash messaging to provide feedback to users, similar to the legacy RedirectWithFlash function.
acceptance_criteria: Flash messages are set during redirects.
Messages are displayed once and cleared after being shown.
Flash messages appear in a consistent format across the application.

functional_requirements.title: HTML Rendering
functional_requirements.description: Render HTML headers and footers consistently, replicating the RenderHeader and RenderFooter functions.
acceptance_criteria: HTML headers include application name and navigation links.
Footers display application information and current time.
HTML is rendered with consistent styling.

functional_requirements.title: Data Encoding and Security
functional_requirements.description: Ensure data is securely encoded for HTML output, replicating HtmlEncode functionality.
acceptance_criteria: All user input is encoded before being rendered in HTML.
No HTML injection vulnerabilities are present.
Encoding is consistent with legacy behavior.

non_functional_requirements.title: Performance
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should perform at least as efficiently as the legacy system.
non_functional_requirements.metric: Response time under 200ms for typical operations
acceptance_criteria: Response times are measured and documented.
Performance is consistent under typical load conditions.
No significant performance degradation from legacy system.

non_functional_requirements.title: Security
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is secure against common web vulnerabilities.
acceptance_criteria: Application passes security audits.
No critical vulnerabilities are present.
Security measures are documented and tested.

non_functional_requirements.title: Scalability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be scalable to handle increased load.
acceptance_criteria: Scalability tests are conducted and documented.
Application supports increased load without performance loss.
Architecture supports horizontal scaling.

non_functional_requirements.title: Reliability
non_functional_requirements.description: Ensure the application is reliable and available.
acceptance_criteria: Downtime is minimized and documented.
Application recovers gracefully from failures.
Monitoring and alerting are in place.

non_functional_requirements.title: Usability
non_functional_requirements.description: The application should be user-friendly and easy to navigate.
acceptance_criteria: User feedback is collected and analyzed.
Navigation is intuitive and consistent.
Documentation and help resources are available.

side_effects: Update order status in Application Orders

assumptions: The legacy functionality is fully understood and documented.
No new features are to be added unless specified.
The application environment supports TypeScript and Docker.

risks.description: Potential for functionality deviation during modernization.
risks.mitigation: Thorough testing and validation against legacy behavior.

risks.description: Security vulnerabilities introduced during code rewrite.
risks.mitigation: Conduct security audits and adhere to best practices.

risks.description: Performance degradation in the new implementation.
risks.mitigation: Performance testing and optimization.

risks.description: Incompatibility with existing deployment environments.
risks.mitigation: Use Docker for consistent deployment environments.

risks.description: Incomplete documentation of legacy functionality.
risks.mitigation: Engage with legacy system experts and conduct thorough code reviews.

out_of_scope: Development of new features beyond legacy functionality.
Integration with external systems not present in the legacy code.

intake.business_request_raw: Modernize the provided legacy codebase into TypeScript. Document current functionality and acceptance criteria, design architecture, implement rewritten services, run QA/security checks, validate requirements, and deploy for local Docker testing.

No new features are to be added unless specified.
The application environment supports TypeScript and Docker.

- Objective: The project aims to modernize a legacy ASP codebase to TypeScript, ensuring backward compatibility and documenting functionality for deployment in a Docker environment.
- Core functional areas: Initialize Application State, User Session Management, User Authentication, Customer Data Display
- Open questions to resolve: 1

architect_output.overview: The architecture modernizes a legacy ASP application to a TypeScript-based modular monolith, ensuring backward compatibility and improved maintainability. The system is designed for local deployment using Docker, facilitating consistent testing and development environments.

services.name: ApplicationStateService
services.responsibility: Manage application-wide state such as total sessions and application name.

services.name: SessionManagementService
services.responsibility: Handle user session lifecycle, including authentication and flash messaging.

services.name: CustomerDataService
services.responsibility: Provide customer data management and display functionality.

services.name: OrderManagementService
services.responsibility: Manage order creation, updating, and retrieval.

auto_scaling_rules: Scale out when CPU usage exceeds 70%
Scale in when CPU usage falls below 30%
scalability.caching_strategy: Use Redis for session and frequently accessed data caching

data_flow.description: User initiates a session and authenticates.
Update application state with new session count.
Authenticated user creates or updates an order.

latency_optimizations: Use in-memory data storage for fast access
Implement Redis caching for session data

trade_offs.rationale: Simplifies the architecture and improves latency for local testing.
Ensures consistent environments for development and testing.
Provides fast access to session and frequently accessed data.

legacy_system.current_logic_summary: The legacy system uses ASP with VBScript to manage application state, user sessions, customer data, and orders.
key_logic_steps: Manage user sessions with authentication and flash messaging.
Authenticate users and manage session state.
Display customer data from in-memory storage.
Create and update orders with validation.
